name: Elizabeth Windsor
blurb: If the queen were a raunchy sass who went on booze cruises and said "sodding" all the time, this would be her Twitter.
tweet: Text from Camilla: "We're here! Is there a smoking room?? Dying for a fag before it all gets underway!"

name: Aaron Levie
blurb: The CEO of Box, Aaron Levie is a great source for unconventional wisdom from the front row of the startup scene.
tweet: Startups often win because it's easier to see what comes next when you don't have to worry about maintaining what came last.

name: Aaron Paul
blurb: The Breaking Bad actor uses Twitter to be funny and to hype worthwhile charitable causes. A winning combination, if you ask us.
tweet: I'm sorry for spelling "masturbating" wrong people. I just wanted to see if you were paying attention. I rely on autocorrect for everything.

name: Adam Platt
blurb: He's a link fiend, but New York's food critic is great as a newsfeed on everything from overhyped chefs to underappreciated desserts.
tweet: How the (patently ridiculous) ‘World’s 50 Best’ list changed the way elite restaurants do business: http://shar.es/Zi6Ln  via @sharethis

name: Alain de Botton
blurb: Every one of de Botton's tweets could be printed on a coffee mug for those who appreicate convenient, but poetic, wisdom.
tweet: Dreams reveal we never quite get over anything. It's all in there somewhere, biding its time.

name: Alex Baze
blurb: This SNL writer's feed is consistently funny, even when the show's jokes fall flat.
tweet: I like to think my father is looking down from heaven and smiling, but he’s actually at an Indian casino with his new wife.

name: Alexia Tsotsis
blurb: For a running feed of TechCrunch's must-reads, just follow the site's co-editor Alexia Tsotsis.
tweet: Is there anything more nouveau bubbly than a dot-com bubble themed "Back to the Bubble" 90s party?

name: Amal Ghandour
blurb: She's a blogger and strategist living in Lebanon, with one of the best feeds on Middle Eastern politics and society.
tweet: My 1st Sunday musing: If the rebels withstand 33 days of Hezbollah/Assad pounding in Qusair, cld they declare this a holy victory?

name: Amanda Hesser
blurb: The former New York Times food writer and founder of Food52.com, Hesser opines mostly on things tech and taste, plus her kids.
tweet: Halfway through decorating Easter eggs, realized that I'd forgotten to *hard-boil* the eggs. And in my head I said a very bad word.

name: Amanda Marcotte
blurb: She calls out unfair expectations and representations of women in media and pop culture, and is a voice of progressive politics.
tweet: I never stop being astonished at the amount of irrational hate one can draw by daring to be female in public without apparent shame over it.

name: Andrew Kaczynski
blurb: One of the most recognizable faces of BuzzFeed, Kaczynski is a tireless source of political humor and news with a refreshing lack of filter.
tweet: The first rule about the all powerful Bike Lobby, you don't talk about the all powerful Bike Lobby.

name: Andrew W.K.
blurb: Very few of you know how to party like Andrew W.K., and that's probably good for your health. Live vicariously, instead.
tweet: PARTY TIP: Don't stress out. Stress is trying to convince you that anxiety is more important than just loving every second of your life.

name: Anonymous
blurb: Regardless of how you feel about Anonymous, they matter, and so do these newsy tweets with frequent links to hacker-liberated files.
tweet: The Supreme Court has voted that police requiring DNA samples upon arrest is constitutional http://bit.ly/132Hmac

name: Anthony De Rosa
blurb: Former Reuters social media editor, who will be starting as Circa editor-in-chief in mid-June, seems to spend most waking hours tweeting in service of the news.
tweet: On CNN, @DarrellIssa asked about AP phone records seizure by DOJ: "When is the Justice Dept going to take responsibility for what it does?"
Fact Check: He's not at joining Circa as Editor-In-Chief on June 17. and it's Circa, not Circo. Also, De Rosa with a capital D

name: Bacon Salt
blurb: You might assume that endless tweeting about Bacon would be boring, but thanks to J&D's Foods (maker of Bacon Salt), we know it's not.
tweet: Every day, thousands of innocent plants are killed by vegetarians. Help end the violence. Eat #Bacon. Be a hero.

name: Baseball America
blurb: All baseball, even way down into the minors. Irony-free, utterly somber, passionately boring updates on America's game.
tweet: Draft Update: When Is The 2013 MLB Draft And Everything Else You Need To Know http://ow.ly/2wQD7Z

name: Ben Schwartz
blurb: You know him from Parks and Rec and House of Lies, so you should obviously tune into Schwartz's twitter feed for funny one-liners.
tweet: Are the bonus features on the "Diners, Drive Ins and Dives" DVD just Guy Fieri taking a bunch of shits?

name: Ben White
blurb: Politico's economic correspondent is required reading for Washington news from an informed skeptic.
tweet: Bloomberg says has had no terminal cancellations due to snooping scandal. This makes sense. Terminal is indispensable. I miss mine.

name: Billy Eichner
blurb: The host of Funny or Die's 'Billy on the Street' is clever off the street, too. Plus, he's not standing there in your face with a mic.
tweet: Is there a Grindr for moms?

name: Blake Shelton
blurb: Who said celebrities can't have a sense of humor? Shelton is known for openly mocking errant tabloid rumors. Keep up the good work, y'all.
tweet: I'm so drunk right now I just walked into a 7-11 put a bag of Skittles in my pants and shouted "Who wants to taste the rainbow?!!"

name: Breaking News
blurb: Seattle-based journos search the web for breaking news, and hardly sleep, it appears. Capitalize on that.
tweet: North Korea says its leader Kim Jong-il has died-@yonhapnews

name: Bruce Bartlett
blurb: Barlett's newsy bits on tax and gold strike that rare balance between snark and substance—and are refreshingly devoid of self-promotion.
tweet: Easiest way to tax corporations: percentage of their market capitalization based on share price one random day each quarter.
Fact Check: Changed to "ARE refreshingly devoid of self-promotion."

name: Chart News
blurb: All you ever wanted to know about Billboard's Weekly Charts, with no distracting hype about the mag itself.
tweet: Thrift Shop by @macklemore & @ryanlewis this week becomes the 1st song in US digital history to top 300,000 in weekly sales 8 times.

name: Chris Dixon
blurb: From his lofty perch as an Andreessen Horowitz investor, Dixon is a well-informed and well-connected source for tech and startup news.
tweet: What were the last Hollywood movies you saw about technology & the future that were optimistic? They seem to be systematically dystopian.
Fact Check: Capital D in Dixon, fixed Andreessen Horowitz misspelling

name: Chris Hadfield
blurb: This astronaut might be back on Earth, but after his epic Twitter run and David Bowie cover while in orbit, we still expect great things.
tweet: Hello from Star City! Air is warm, swans on the pond, flowers in bloom, everything green with the start of Russian summer. Photos to follow.

name: Chris Hayes
blurb: MSNBC anchor offers a blend of news, commentary and progressive opinions. If only he would stop trying to create his own trending hashtags.
tweet: Next plot twist in Rob Ford saga: Toronto mayor heads to Syria to help organize opposition, while former Syria envoy becomes Toronto mayor

name: Chrissy Teigen
blurb: If nothing else, Teigen will blow away any stereotypes you're harboring about models with nothing interesting to say. Bold, pointed, funny.
tweet: New York cemeteries. Ain't nobody got room for that.

name: Colin Meloy
blurb: Some insight into the creative process of The Decemberists' lead singer, but mostly entertaining info about his toddler and Portland life.
tweet: Must get out of the habit of saying 'party foul' every time my newborn baby spits up on me.

name: David Chang
blurb: He's not the most prolific tweeter, but Momofuku's master chef offers followers a glimpse into the mind of a pork bun pioneer.
tweet: why shouldn't top kitchens use MSG as a finishing salt if data suggests its not an allergen & no short cuts are used in cooking process?

name: David J. Roth
blurb: Not to be confused with the guy from Van Halen, this Roth is a journalist who says funny and interesting things on Twitter.
tweet: You can harsh on the Senate all you like, but the fact remains that only 90% of Americans were into expanding background checks on guns.

name: Dennis Rodman
blurb: Even if he never tweets anything again, Rodman will have already reminded us how strange this world is. The future of U.S. diplomacy?
tweet: I'm calling on the Supreme Leader of North Korea or as I call him "Kim", to do me a solid and cut Kenneth Bae loose.

name: Downtown Josh Brown
blurb: Brilliant one-liners mixed with insightful comments and posts on the markets and investing. Prolific, relentless and hilarious.
tweet: the nine-disc DVD set of Hip Hop Abs just arrived...changing into Lycra.

name: Eric Topol
blurb: This California cardiologist is an encylopedia on the heart and other medical mysteries.
tweet: Remember when banks didn't have ATMs? Think ahead to the future of medicine.....

name: Errol Morris
blurb: He follows exactly zero people, but don't take it personally. "Fog of War" filmmaker is an interesting/funny dude who doesn't overtweet.
tweet: I think I might be tripolar.

name: Ezra Koenig of Vampire Weekend
blurb: The lead singer of Vampire Weekend favors eclectic humor and stream-of-conscious missives.
tweet: i had three russian great aunts named Manya, Tanya & Fanya. true story. MY FAMILY'S BEEN RHYMING FOR GENERATIONS

name: Felix Salmon
blurb: Just because everyone else loves him, doesn't mean we can't, too. This Reuters blogger talks economics in a way regular people can digest.
tweet: Currently debating: Which god did the people of Moore anger?

name: Florida Man
blurb: Florida Man knows that Florida truth is way stranger than fiction.
tweet: Florida Man Arrested For Drunken Rotisserie Chicken Theft, Carrying Hidden Handcuff Keys To Lock Up "Crazy" Friend | http://buff.ly/16Bfbpy

name: Hari Kunzru
blurb: British author (most recent book: Gods Without Men) living in Brooklyn with a Twitter taste for international news and fiction news.
tweet: Recent tweet from Mayor of Ankara: "We could drown you in a spoon of water, but luckily for you we believe in democracy." #Turkey
Fact Check: Capital K. And its Gods Without Men, Not Men Without Gods, and the book isn't "new," it was released in 2011.

name: Harvard Health
blurb: It often pushes Harvard studies, but in this case, that's a good thing, if you want to keep abreast of diseases and medical breakthroughs.
tweet: Harvard discovery reverses aging in mouse hearts. http://hvrd.me/YRiWnb  Could it work in humans, too?

name: Hillary Clinton
blurb: With a nod to the creators of the Texts From Hillary meme, the former Secretary of State joined the Twitterverse in early June. #Hillary2016?
tweet: Thanks for the inspiration @ASmith83 & @Sllambe - I'll take it from here... #tweetsfromhillary

name: Hugh Acheson
blurb: The great thing about Acheson's feed is its lack of pretention. Instagrammed food and tweeted, random thoughts from an industry star.
tweet: BBQ shrimp at Mr B's last night was great, but the whole grown man putting a bib on me was a little strange. I was, luckily, fully clothed.

name: Hunter Walk
blurb: One-stop Twitter shop for news and analysis on startups from the former director of product management at Google turned venture capitalist.
tweet: Why are iOS apps allowed to repeatedly ask me to rate them or remind me later. No dismiss/stop.

name: IDF Spokesperson
blurb: The Israel Defense Force's feed was a watershed moment in social media. It tweets movements of troops and platitudes of support.
tweet: Update: A firebomb was thrown at an #IDF vehicle near #Bethlehem. IDF forces found a bag w/ 2 firebombs in the area. The search is ongoing

name: James Poniewozik
blurb: Time columnist knows his pop culture, and can tell a good joke at the expense of politicians and journalists.
tweet: No idea how good Shymalan's WAYWARD PINES will be, but he's going to lose it when some AV Club commenter figures out the twist in week 1

name: Jason Good
blurb: Not all comedians are funny on Twitter. Same goes for dads. Jason is both, and is hilarious.
tweet: I can still hear Chris Christie breathing after I turn off the TV

name: Jay Horwitz
blurb: Proof that you don't have to be 20 to use Twitter correctly, the VP of media relations for the Mets is a funny and engaging tweeter.
tweet: Have the start of flu coming on. Stopped on the way to park to pick up some Medical Marijuana.It's legal here you know.Game should be fun.

name: Jenna Wortham
blurb: She's one of the hip ladies on the tech desk of the NY Times, offering unpretentious thoughts on culture, tech, and Brooklyn.
tweet: ugh god there goes my wednesday. all i'm doing now is snapchatting taco bell

name: Jenni Konner
blurb: Lena Dunham's BFF and Girls showrunner mixes jokes with occasional behind-the-scenes glimpses of the zeitgeitsy HBO show.
tweet: There's no USWeekly at the airport. Do they cancel all flights?

name: Jenny Johnson
blurb: Because she took on Chris Brown and won, but also because she continued to be hilarious long after Brown deleted his Twitter.
tweet: If you ever feel bad about yourself, just remember Brad Pitt has Billy Bob Thornton's sloppy seconds.

name: Jessica Valenti
blurb: She calls herself a "feminist killjoy," but The Nation writer tends a feed that's as much enlightening as it is acerbic.
tweet: Misogynist comedian challenge: Go 24 hrs w/o using 'cunt', 'Birkenstocks', 'fat', or 'feminazi' and I will consider taking you seriously

name: John Jannuzzi
blurb: An unfiltered peek into the mind of the Lucky magazine editor. Some tweets are incoherent, others hiarious, and nearly all entertaining.
tweet: oh god it's raining and somebody just put on the xx. must free self of emo darkness chamber.

name: Jon Hendren
blurb: Not only does he have the best Twitter handle ever, this writer for somethingawful.com will make you chuckle on the regs.
tweet: eating a cold cut combo alone in a 24 hr subway to November Rain and getting a little emotional if we can be honest

name: Jonathan Capehart
blurb: The Washington Post opinion writer specializes in concise commentary and direct responses to questions and criticisms.
tweet: #Obama on #IRS:....If what happened is as reported "That's outrageous. And there's no place for it."

name: Jose Canseco
blurb: From his open call for a pro bono attorney to the premature declaration of Al Gore's death, Canseco, uh, knocks his Tweets out of the park.
tweet: Can't believe Barbara Walters is gone I used to mix up her and Madonna .

name: Julie Klausner
blurb: A master of pithy jokes and punchlines, Klausner will probably be uber-famous in a few years. Follow her now and say you knew her when.
tweet: One day, when the doorbell rings, I'll stop saying to my cat "Ooooh Jimmy, is that your GIIIIRRRLFRIEND???" But that day is not today.

name: Katie Baker
blurb: A Grantland A-lister, Baker is great on most things related to sports and awkwardness.
tweet: I turned on The Biggest Loser 15 seconds ago and I'm already bawling.

name: Katie Grand
blurb: Editor of the consistently exciting fashion mag Love, Grand's feed is full of fun missives from her life and juicy fashion instagrams.
tweet: Best line ever from Working Girl "six thousand dollars and its not even leather"

name: Kim Jong Number Un
blurb: This fake Twitter account for the guy running North Korea makes us wish the real dictator had a sense of humor.
tweet: Let me stop all the rumors right now - I am not pregnant.

name: Laura Brown
blurb: Pithy humor meets fashion fodder in this feed from the executive editor of Harper's Bazaar. Plus, some great Instagram link-outs.
tweet: You know what's chic? Doing a shoot at home about your fabulous life, and rummaging for clothing in your dry cleaning bag.

name: Laura Rozen
blurb: Nearly half of Rozen's feed is retweets of relevant articles and context on all-things-Middle East. She's fast and informed.
tweet: Many signs of growing international consensus on a roadmap for Syria crisis resolution. who knows if will succeed

name: Liz Gumbinner
blurb: She used to be in advertising, and has the wit to prove it. Half modern motherly insight, half hilarious everywoman.
tweet: I'm happy for you women who look gorgeous pregnant. Mostly.

name: Maggie Haberman
blurb: A solid mix of inside-baseball political fodder and breaking news, from one of Politico's star reporters. Warning: favors RTs.
tweet: Weiner is trying to re-run his 2005, somewhat below-the-radar strategy. I think - I THINK - that will be harder this time

name: Matt Zoller Seitz
blurb: If he's not asleep, the editor of RogerEbert.com and beloved New York Mag TV critic is on Twitter. A mix of culture and personal insights.
tweet: Put John Slattery behind the camera of a drug-fueled episode, what do you get? Screwball Scorsese in suits. #MadMen

name: Michael Voltaggio
blurb: Winner of the 6th season of Top Chef, in which he beat out his brother, Voltaggio tweets about his adventures in restauranting in L.A.
tweet: Is it too much to ask an employee to show up for work sober?

name: Molly Ball
blurb: A smart progressive on politics, tweeting not just her own good work at the Atlantic but other worthwhile reads.
tweet: The number of hotels that now offer cookies at check-in is proof of the greatness of capitalism.

name: Nervana Mahmoud
blurb: Few are better versed in the triumph and turmoil of the Middle East than Mahmoud, who tweets reliable insights on a critical region.
tweet: #Syrians should be proud of their fight for freedom, but they shouldn't tolerate barbarism in the name  of their revolution.  #Syria

name: New Scientist
blurb: More science news than you can shake a stick at, and with appeal for the masses, too.
tweet: Thermal picture shows the surface of an emperor penguin's body is colder than the air around it. Some feat http://ow.ly/kQ3YI

name: Not Will Ferrell
blurb: The actual Will Ferrell does have a Twitter, but it’s nothing compared to this guy, who has wriggled into Ferrell’s brain and set up shop.
tweet: If Monday had a face, I would kick its face in the balls.

name: Old Spice
blurb: With humor just as sarcastic and virile as you'd expect, Old Spice makes marketing on Twitter a worthwhile follow.
tweet: Don't understand why people still need CDs when Old Spice is music to the nostrils.

name: Olivia Wilde
blurb: Sure, she's a movie star and Jason Sudeikis' bride-to-be, but  she tweets like your funny best friend who happens to be cooler than you.
tweet: "Don't trip on Anna Wintour and fall down stairs naked while spilling hot gravy on your face." - my silent prayer during tonight's Met Ball.

name: Paul Feig
blurb: The director of Bridesmaids favors tart observations and har-har punchlines.
tweet: If my dog pees on a tree next to an outdoor cafe, everyone thinks it's cute. If I pee on that tree, people scream & I get arrested. #notfair

name: Phil Jackson
blurb: Legenday coach Phil Jackson knows his sports, of course. A must follow for hoops fans and anyone curious about the mind of a great coach.
tweet: NBA rules committee shud make a rule change. Naismith set up the game to eliminate fouling, therefore a team shud not profit from fouls.

name: Playground Dad
blurb: This feed is as much about being a more attentive parent as it is about life as the father of four daughters.
tweet: At the end of the school year the teachers send home so much crap….um, I mean my child's art and schoolwork that I value incredibly.

name: Pocket Hits
blurb: Ferrets out great things to read and, with a separate app, let's you save them in your 'pocket' to read later. Good before a job interview.
tweet: "Inside Google's Secret Lab." @bradstone, @BW http://bit.ly/12ZWXYB  #MostSaved #longreads

name: Rob Delaney
blurb: Offends, delights, and insults with charming aplomb. We also love that he is a brazen feminist.
tweet: When a guy calls a woman a "feminazi," it would be a funny joke for her to work him to death then cook him in an oven.

name: Robert A George
blurb: New York Post editorial writer who manages to mix politics, humor and bizarre hashtags (#jewishPornTitles, anyone?) with aplomb.
tweet: So, as deficit shrinks, which side is first to admit that "fiscal cliff" combo -- tax increase+sequester -- actually worked? #tabootopics

name: Robert Costa
blurb: Goes deep into the GOP's raucous if predictable fights over the debt ceiling, sequester, entitlement reform and more.
tweet: McConnell on the IRS scandal: "I told you so" -- says he's been concerned about the admin's pressuring of political speech for yrs. More tk

name: RuPaul
blurb: The world's most famous drag queen is bold, clever and she talks to her fans. Winning!
tweet: Mama said: "Who needs a cigarette lighter when U've got the stove"

name: Ruby Cramer
blurb: She's a cub reporter, but adds some levity to politics coverage with her Buzzfeed bent for listicles and banter.
tweet: If Christie calls for elex in Oct, costing mills, Dems will go through every budget item Christie has vetoed as way to push back, source sez

name: Sallie Krawcheck
blurb: A former Wall Street heavyweight, Krawcheck's feed is filled with Street commentary and news about women business leaders.
tweet: 5 Steps to Impact Investing w/ a Gender Lens, Melanie Hamburger @85Broads #InvestinWomen http://po.st/y8JM6M

name: Sarah Dessen
blurb: YA author Dessen tweets mostly about her mostly upbeat life as a mother, wife, and writer in Chapel HIll, N.C.
tweet: Starting to get really nervous about telling my kid she has to get shots this morning. Trying to channel calming energy, like Cesar Milan.

name: Sarah Weinman
blurb: The Publishers Marketplace editor does what everyone on Twitter should strive to do: post interesting thoughts and interesting links.
tweet: So I'm not quite ready to commit to this statement fully but...I think PI fiction is making a comeback. And about time, too.

name: Sesame Street
blurb: For a respite from snark and  self-promotion, Sesame Street's feed is a welcome light-hearted destination.
tweet: Grover: Another joke from your furry pal Grover. Why did the monster cross the road? Because it was the chicken's day off! Ah, humor.

name: Shankar Vedantam
blurb: NPR's science correspondent is one of those people who devours news of all kinds, and shares the best of what he reads.
tweet: We've heard it takes a village to act ethically. Does it take a village to act unethically? http://ow.ly/lsSLm

name: Sherman Alexie
blurb: Winner of the PEN/Faulkner prize for fiction, Alexie tweets all seem off the cuff—sometimes witty, sometimes insightful, usually personal.
tweet: I don't believe in Jesus as supernatural figure. I do believe in him as a pioneering social justice worker.

name: Stefanie Wilder Taylor
blurb: The NickMom host of Parental Discretion likes fancy vinegar, black jellybeans and the Lifetime Movie Network. What more do you ask for?
tweet: I'm home schooling my kids! And by home schooling I mean letting them watch Fresh Beat Band while they're home sick.

name: Steve Case
blurb: Case founded AOL, but he’s no one-hit wonder. Remains carefully tuned into the tech, politics and business worlds, and you can, too.
tweet: Are foodies quietly killing rock-and-roll? http://wapo.st/11Z9vP0  "Cuisine is stealing music’s role in helping young people forge identity"

name: The Daddy Complex
blurb: David Vienna is the writer behind this feed and the father of twin boys Wyatt and Boone. Simply put: it's funny and his kids are cute.
tweet: This morning I tried a new tactic with our boys. My wife was Good Cop, like usual, but I was Fucking Lunatic Cop. Results were mixed.

name: Tim Marchman
blurb: This editor at The Classical is on top of everything, and if you follow him, you will at least be able to pretend you are, too.
tweet: Trying and failing to think of a team/athlete as contemptuous as the Heat when they're indignant.

name: Tracie Egan Morissey
blurb: For all lovers of Jezebel, the site's editor offers a similar spin on gossip and news in just 140 characters, plus clever one-liners.
tweet: It's time to retire "lady boner."

name: Vital Voices
blurb: Spotlighting events and articles about female leadership around the world, the feed is a great way to stay informed and inspired.
tweet: From Uruguay to Silicon Valley & back, Fortune/State mentee Agustina shares why she's now dreaming bigger than ever: http://ow.ly/lkR7m

name: Will McAvoy
blurb: If you agree that HBO's “The Newsroom” is terribly overwrought, this is a good way to skip it and imagine if the anchor simply tweeted.
tweet: Oh, God. We've moved on to analyzing if Obama cried or not during his press conference. #WeAreNowhere

name: Wiz Khalifa
blurb: A window into the rapper's wacky world, with some touching bursts of normalcy, like his description of daughter's kisses on the nose.
tweet: Yesterday wuz intense. Chilled wit Bash, seen Problem kill it, played some pool, bombed sum hills, recorded 2 verses for da album. Intense

name: Women for Women International
blurb: Women for Women works to help female war survivors. Its feed stays on top of its mission with well-honed news items and event updates.
tweet: Heartwarming update on Aesha Mohammadzai, the young Afghan girl whose husband cut of her ears and nose as punishment. http://ow.ly/kV909

name: Your Life Coaches
blurb: This trio of funny dudes puts together satirical (but also maybe kind of real?) advice. Follow it, or just get a good laugh.
tweet: In the spirit of paying it forward, insincerely suck up to at least one celebrity on Twitter today. We've neglected them for so long.
